str2: From kata; and hos and tis; according to which certain thing, i.e. As far as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Feminine participle present passive of oikeo; land, i.e. The globe; specially, the Roman empire.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From dikaios; equity; specially justification.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From horion; to mark out or bound, i.e. to appoint, decree, specify.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and echo; to hold near, i.e. Present, afford, exhibit, furnish occasion.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
